12402770.review:
Groovy puzzle platformer. Light on reflex platforming and more focused on exploration, humor and riddles. It is a wild ride into the minds of people living in a paper world. Like Psychonauts - game’s obvious influence - its humor is self-referential and clever, while peeking into minds of others is thrilling, and can be scary sometimes.

[url=http://www.hardcoregamer.com/2013/12/26/review-stick-it-to-the-man/67642/]Geoff Thew in his review[/url] gives great examples of the type of humor you can expect here:

[quote]Stick It to The Man is an eminently sly and self-aware game. This is a story of paper men living in a sidescrolling world, and they know it. The hazmat container only drops in the first place because the paper airplane carrying it falls apart in a storm. Ray always forgets how much jumping is involved in his morning commute, but when lost he remembers that the way home is to “go right, and then go right, and then pretty much keep going all the way to the right.” This is classic adventure game humor with a sharp edge, and it’s riotously funny.[/quote]

12371733.review:
Although my playtime says I've only played it for a little over an hour, I've completed the game and had I played it through Steam, I'd probably have most of the achievements. Not that that last part matters all that much, but it gives you an idea of how interesting even the side content of this game can be. 

That being said, even disregarding what my playtime says, the game is pretty short in length (probably around 6-8 hours, I'd say, less if you don't read everything's mind) and while some of the enemy evasion sections feel a little on the strict side in terms of getting them just right to get past the guards, the rest of the game is very enjoyable. Especially so if you're not sure what to make of the game and pick it up on a sale. Many of the puzzles are amusing and creative in their own right, often pulling themselves together through the pleasantly bizarre mechanic that the game hinges on, peeling the thoughts from other characters and inexplicably making them real, or peeling parts/items from other characters or the environment for use elsewhere. 

There are some moments where you may find yourself wondering where to use some of the gathered items, the stickers as they call them (hence the game's name), but generally it becomes a rather straightforward affair of picking up what you can and figuring out what remains available to interact with to progress. If you're looking for a laidback puzzle platformer that takes more design cues from old adventure games than games like Braid, and an interesting art style, an enjoyable soundtrack, and a somewhat amusing sense of humor, you can't go too wrong with this game. 

What it may lack in length and challenge, it more than makes up for in its variety of amusing scenarios.

12200655.review:
Stick it to the man is a game that bases itself in absurdity in quite a pleasant manner. This, combined with the world aesthetic can lead to some pretty extraordinary and hilarious situations. And when I say hilarious, I mean times I genuinely laughed at the clever dialogue and puzzles before me. I even went through and tried to find all the funny dialogue I could, which is quite the achievement.

The aesthetic for the game is a world made of paper, string to hold things in place, and stickers. With your giant purple hand, you can remove and place stickers in different situations to solve puzzles. For example, if you place a horse head next to a singer, she'll think she's being attacked by the mob, and scream, at which point you can take her screaming mouth and use it somewhere else. It's very creative, fresh, and compelling.

The story and characters were very likable, especially Ray. He wasn't a perfect person, but he made a perfect protagonist. Paired with lovely voice acting, it was truly something special.

If I had one problem with it, I would say that there were too many chase areas in the levels. While you could create a checkpoint after clearing it once, there were too few ways to solve them for the number of times it was iterated, and often was unreliable at times when trying to grab thoughts and hitting pins instead, resulting in a quick death.

All in all, this game was a nice experience. It didn't take too long to beat, around 5 hours, but the time I did spend with it was incredible. An excellent story wrapped up in a competent game with an amazing presentation.

PS版本被译作《男人要坚强》，似乎是2011年推出的，PC是2012年。
这个游戏的故事发生在一个纸片世界里，所有建筑、设施以及生物都是纸片的，主角Ray因为一个偶然的机会，被一个外星生物Ted附在了身上，让他脑袋上出现一只别人无法见到的手，从此他就有了读取别人大脑的能力，并且能用这只手撕下物品。但他的生活也因此改变，因为运输外星人的Boss“The Man”及手下想尽办法要夺回外星人，Ray必须巧妙地利用读心能力，获取不同的物品，帮助自己出奇制胜。
游戏的主要内容就是利用好主角的读心能力，从不同的人物那获取信息及秘密，收集不同的物品和人们交换物品、帮助人们解决困难或是用这些物品制造事故，以便通过难题。游戏的一个亮点就是看到千奇百怪的人们的内心世界，大都可不是表面那么美好，另一个亮点是各种异想天开惹人发笑的解除谜题办法，充满了趣味。
游戏的画面像是木偶剧布景一样的感觉，精致又色彩丰富，漫画风格比较讨人喜爱，但是整体比较阴暗，人物和场景看起来有些诡异，这是因为主题就是读心，心理中的某些面被放大，直接体现在了游戏场景中，但是习惯了这种风格后，还真是有点欲罢不能的感觉，主要是游戏方式很特别很新奇，游戏过程又很轻松有随心所欲的感觉，甚至还有一种满足窥视欲的感觉，所以真是挺好玩，我觉得大多数人玩上都会喜欢上它。

12021056.review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Knr4_tfkGtk

Point and click has been a genre that has struggled the last ten years, With the market peaking in the 90’s with games like, Monkey Island, and ever since then the genre has struggled to find a foothold with the rise of counsels. Point and Click was hard to do on a counsel because you will, point and click.  There have been attempts to revive the genre, but not much has happened with it except for re- releases and re-makes. Until now, 

Stick it to the man is a game that advertises as an action platformer, but its really a point and click game in disguise, it also a game very much about comedy.  Here Let me give you a basic plot description, The Main Character Has Psychic powers, can read peoples minds to help solve their problems, its has a unique artstyle and sense of humor. There is also platforming and puzzle solving.

Now if you know anything about good games your mind should instantly think of Psychonauts, and if you don’t know Psychonauts, 1st you should, and second go watch the Zero punctuation review on it or something, but if you’re to even do that then ill explain, Psychonauts, is an action platformer, puzzle solver, with unique art style and sense of humor, The main character also can read minds.

So now that i’ve gotten that comparison out of the way, I’ll talk more about this game, The art style of the game is a mixture between the weirdness of psychonauts, and the Cardboard of tearaway. The game also has a depth to it, you can move up and down the foreground, and background like in little big planet, but  the game never uses this to its advantage, i can only remember using it one time and that was when i discover i could even do it.

The Music in the game is repetitive unfortunately, every time you run into an enemy it plays the same music until you’ve successfully escaped, its always the same no variation of bad guy music.

The Gameplay of the game is centered around one central gimmick, your mind arm, Your mind arm is somthing you get in the very beginning of the game, and its what makes this game. It is your  cursor, its what you use to interact with the world, It's what lets you read minds to solve problems, it helps you platform acting like a grappling hook. Its what manages your inventory, and tears off stickers. 

Sticker by the way are exactly what they sound like they are parts of the world that have been highlighted that you can rip off and stick to other things using your mind arm. You can get stickers by finding highlighted things in the world, or by reading someone's mind see what they are thinking of the literally ripping the thought out of their mind as a sticker. Stickers are the items used to solve the puzzles the game presents you with and you can have more than one at a time, this is where the inventory comes in. The inventory is just the d-pad left and right on the controller, it keeps it simple and easy. 

The Control of the mind arm is… not so great. It you use the right analog stick to aim the arm, then it has an auto lock on to objects, the auto lock works but its also a problem. When there is more than one character next to another (which happens a lot by the way) it becomes hard to lock on to who you want to read  the mind of sometimes only allowing certain angles. The platforming is also floaty, it just doesn't feel super responsive, some of that may be attributed to the artstyle, but at some points especially when around enemies, you just don't feel like you have the amount of control you should.

Floaty Controls aside, its the story and style that makes a point and click game, and boy does it have it in spades. This game is funny, thats hard to find in games now a days, you either have absurd humor, like goat simulator, or good character dialog like in borderlands. This game does both surprisingly well. 

Ill give you an example of one of the puzzles, in one portion of the game you are tasked with escaping an insane asylum on and island. You meet tons of crazy characters each with different personalities and goals, You meet a captain who says he’s slain a great whale, you eventually find this whale decomposing, you also meet a taxidermist in the asylum, you bring her to the what and she sows it up, you then meet a man who is hyperventilating into a bag, you take this mans you take this man to the whale and he blows into the bowl hole filling it with air, you now have a raft made out of a dead whale that you use to escape the island. 
If dead whale raft isn't funny to you, then something's wrong with you, or your an animal rights activist who doesn't like video games. The entire game is filled with over the top moments like that.

This does bring up some points negative though, almost all point and clicks suffer from this, and that is convoluted puzzles, you know when you just don't know what to do so you have to try everything with everything else, yah that moment. Fortunately it doesn't happen that often but when it happens it really slow the games pace down. 

The game also has a lot of backtracking, like most point and clicks . Most of the game takes place on large maps that you have to fully explore to solve the puzzles, and get to the next area, but the backtracking isn't that bad and there are some parts in the game that will let you do a quick travel to certain areas.

Although this game definitely suffers from all the problems that have always plagued Point and clicks, it works well and is definitely the benchmark for a counsel point and click game, so if soul successor to Psychonauts sounds good to you, dont hesitate to buy.

11924814.review:
Ah, ben une chouette surprise que ce Stick it to The Man, je vais essayer de faire court : si Monkey Island, Little Big Planet, Paper Mario et Psychonauts avaient une relation (assez sale), SITTM serait sans doute le monstre qui en résulterait.

Alors certes, la difficulté n'est pas forcément au rendez-vous : on se ballade dans des environnements en 2.5D, confrontés à des personnages face à leurs problèmes, et il nous incombera de lire dans leurs pensées pour trouver le bon objet afin d'en débloquer un autre, pour ensuite aider un autre protagoniste. Le tout est entrecoupé de quelques maigres phases de plateforme, et un PETIT soupçon d'infiltration par moments.

Si on fait, au final, un peu toujours la même chose, c'est peut-être pour ne pas faire d'ombre à l'écriture ainsi qu'à la direction artistique, toutes deux au poil : l'équipe derrière ce petit jeu s'est éclatée et les situations complètement absurdes dans lesquelles se trouvent le joueur sont toujours bien trouvées, cyniques et décomplexées.
Le doublage, également de très bonne facture, appuie les nombreuses blagues qui m'auront bien fait sourire !

Bref, je conseille SITTM aux amateurs de jeu d'aventure recherchant davantage un scénar' bien barré et original (et désirant contrôler un spaghetti violet sortant de votre crâne) qu'un challenge qui ferait trop bouillir les méninges.

11914908.review:
I was sold by the Kenny Rogers theme song upon startup but it turns out that this game is incredibly funny and charming. The paper art style is really amazing and the characters you meet along the way all fit the crazy and stylized look. Mechanics enhance the 2D platforming and support the humor of the diologue.

This is a truly funny game (if you like this kind of bizarre comedy) which is something that not many games can say about themselves. 

If you liked Psychonauts at all, you will like this game. It has similar themes, style, humor, and even a similar name for the main character. The game is somewhat nostalgic with the paper/cardboard art and is very fun to play (if you don't mind being stopped to hear some minor characters engage in a bit of banter every two minutes).

11914797.review:
Stick it to The Man! è strano. E' un puzzle platformer con sfacettature di un punta e clicca, ma non eccelle in nessuno dei due aspetti.

Le meccaniche principali di Stick it to the Man! è leggere nella mente della gente per ottenere informazioni e manipolare la realtà per ottenere abilità o oggetti per completare gli schemi, il tutto mentre delle guardie tenteranno di inseguirti e ucciderti. 

La parte della lettura del pensiero è abbastanza noiosa. La recitazione è molto gradevole, ma qualche personaggio parla veramente lento e quando finisci di leggere i sottotitoliil personaggio sarà probabilmente solo a metà del discorso. I dialogi non possono esseri skippati parzialmente ma solo mandati avanti veloce o skippati per intero. 

Il gameplay non è nulla di speciale praticamente durante l'intero gioco devi evitare gli agenti e leggere le menti di tutti gli npc per ottenere degli oggetti che sbloccano il susseguirsi degli eventi . Non mi ha divertito particolarmente nessuno dei segmenti del gioco.
La parte "forte" di Stick it to the Man è sicuramente quella artistica. Il character design è eccezionale in quasi tutti i personaggi presenti nella storia, ogni npc è unico e con personalità differente dagli altri. Tutto il mondo è composto di cartone e la grafica è strutturata in un finto 3D con personaggi bidimensionali.
La traduzione in italiano dei sottotitoli è molto scadente, alcune frasi perdono fortemente di contestualizzazione, a volte addirittura di significato!

Concludendo, non penso di consigliare questo gioco, ma, se vi piace stupirvi con effetti artistici vi potrebbe anche piacere.

11883234.review:
In a spectacular world made entirely of paper, Stick It to the Man provides an opportunity for reliving your childhood dream of slapping stickers on everything. Well, perhaps not everything.

The game opens with Ray, the player character, whose job is testing hard-hats. The symbolism behind Ray’s career is soon apparent when an accident occurs that leaves him with severe head trauma. The moral? Wear a hard-hat on construction sites, literally. While not offering a great deal of difficulty with its platform-style mechanics, Stick It presents gamers with something refreshingly unique in a video game – a comedic look at the tragic effect of a decadent society on the mental health of its members. Ray’s ability to read minds and the obstacles that follow as the result of the accident become a constant, subconscious reminder to always keep your head, i.e. mental health, protected.

When Ray wakes up, he a notices that there is a neon-pink arm sticking out of his head. This chimerical arm is your best friend. The arm gives Ray the ability to read minds and navigate the game space. It also serves to help Ray rip stickers (in traditional puzzle solvers these would be the “items” in your inventory) out of the game world as well as NPC minds, and stick them in different places to solve puzzles. Ray, however, finds the protuberance alarming and sets off to find a way to get rid of it. As no one else can see it but himself, Ray’s first plan is to head to a psychiatrist who, we soon see, needs more help than he does. 

The game is divided into ten chapters in which Ray is faced with several obstacles to moving on to the next stage. Ray gets around these hindrances by helping other characters with their troubles – and a colourful cast of oddballs it is who require Ray’s help. From a suicidal taxi driver who wants a new set of teeth to a woman with an abandonment complex who prefers her pets taxidermied, Stick It leaves no allusions to obsessive compulsions or mental ailments untouched. The game does not stop there. The social stigma that accompanies those with mental disorders is also represented by a cast of mental institution staff and law enforcement officials who are constantly chasing Ray and locking up those who are deemed unfit.

Stick It does not suggest slapping stickers on, what are serious problems in real life, as a solution. That would be all too easy. What Stick It does do, is create a turbulent backdrop of a modern city with the imaginative use of art and colour in order to present, and make you think about, a tragic social problem. More importantly, it does so in a game that is packaged with distinct style, charming characters, comedic dialogue and a genuine, if naïve, notion that love will conquer all. 

I say play it.

11755431.review:
Stick it to the Man! is a really humorous game. It's kind of a puzzle-platformer combined with a point-and-click adventure game. I myself am no big fan of P&Cs in general, but still I liked the game. 

It manages to stand out with its distinctive "papercut/sticker book" artstyle. The voice-acting is brilliant. The story is kinda serviceable in a not-very-realistic-at-all way, but of course the humour is the selling point. 

I found the puzzles to be fair in difficulty. I actually played this 9 months back, so can't recall exactly but I think I managed to complete it without consulting any guides. Or may just once time. Thing is, I am not a P&C gamer so if you are used to playing stuff like that, this shouldn't be a problem. 

Length wise, I'd say the game should be around 5 - 7 hours long, depending on how fast you solve the puzzles of course. 

I'd say Stick it to the Man! is a one-of-a-kind game. Surely, if you either love humour, or puzzle-platformers or P&Cs (better still if you love two or more of them!), you need to get this game!

Devs can definately make a sequel of it. I'll be waiting!

11356020.review:
"The arm is sticking out of my head" 
Played the game in one sitting, took me 7 hours. I couldn't stop. 
Essentially your character is visited by a brainsluggish alien, giving you the super powers of (albeit limited) psychokinesis, mind reading and ... erm altering peoples thoughts into stickers for later use (in the same manner some comic books uses their speech bubbles as an actual part of the world).
Art direction is excellent, voice acting is super. Puzzles not so much. It's more or less a casual adventure platformer with wacky characters in which you combine  stickers to fix a problem and your "mind-hand" to get further down the path and story. Gameplay feels slick (only used a 360-pad though), a bit like Bionic Commando, but again the emphasis lies with the story and fun exploring nature. 

tl;dr 
Fry from Futurama in a jazzy noir Paper Mario-world, drenched in a bucket of Psychonauts.

11218532.review:
Tim Schafer didn't make this, but he could have. If you like Double Fine's games like Psychonauts or old LucasArts adventure games, you'll probably enjoy this. It's a 2.5D side-scrolling action platformer with enemies that you need to be quick to avoid, and also a strongly characterized humourous adventure game where you collect items (in sticker form, of course) to solve ridiculous puzzles and advance the storyline.
The protagonist is Ray - a hapless yutz that exists in a world made of paper. Through an accident, he involuntarily gains telepathic/telekinetic powers. Because of his new abilities, he is pursued by The Man responsible for his fate for the rest of the game.
Takes about 5 hours to play all the way through, and works very well with a keyboard and mouse - though the in-game instructions are primarily focused on the use of a controller.

11188999.review:
This game was one of the best adventure games I've ever played. The jokes were close by, each of them funny and punchy. The music was fun - most of it wasn't memorable at all, yet it fit perfectly, but the title song was magic. The art was unique, original, fun, and throughout the game world are little background and foreground jokes that add a bit of spice to an already fantastic looking game. Characters were lively, silly, voiced EXCELLENTLY, their inner thoughts giving way to some very good jokes - it's little homages to gaming were tasty icing to naturally good comedy - that actually handle scat humour with real wit. You learned to love our little protagonist and his head... thing. While the puzzles were strange, they made sense, and the wonderful thing about this game that they were solved simply by curiously peeking into peoples thoughts everywhere you went, and you wouldn't play this game if you didn't want to do that. And, like many other people, the game is actually fun for the brief sections where you run from the guards. Those parts get harder with a proper curve, and are fun, and briefly exhilirating. It was a nice way to counter balance the slow puzzling. And the length? It had a story to tell, and it told it quickly. This kind of game was more like a movie than anything else, and the running gag can only last so long. So, by not making looong pointless areas, they condensed everything to a perfectly proportioned pie of funny and pictures and visual stimuli, with a quick, fun story. I wouldn't want it longer, because everything they did felt good. I didn't feel like I wanted more - was satisfied, and laughing. And that, with good voice acting, art style, jokes, pacing, gameplay, game mechanincs, characters, music, and identity, is really, all you can ask for, isn't it? And this game had all of that in SPADES. LARGE SPADES. SHOVELS, EVEN.
10/10, Liked It, 5 Stars, *****. And it's not satanically expensive! Buy it!
Buy it now! Give it to your friends that don't normally play games! Give it to the ones that do! PAINT RAY'S FACE ONTO YOUR OWN AND GET MOBBED BY CROWDS OF PEOPLE FOR BEING BEAUTIFUL.

I absolutely love this game. The grimy, corrupt city feels like a 1970s caricature of New York, with all the necessary absurdities including disco, organized crime and sewer gators. A flat world of paper and stickers is vindicated by colorful themes, creative implementation and a great soundtrack, things I often feel the AAA titles are lacking. Emphasis on mind reading, psychology and the mind itself feel reminiscent of Psychonauts by Double Fine.

If anything, my only complaint would be play time. With only two hours played I appear to already be close to 1/3 of the way to the end. Despite this, 6 hours of stimulation that far exceeds the enjoyment of any movie I've seen in theaters this year makes the $15 investment well worth the cost.

11042954.review:
Stick it to The Man! is... strange. It's a puzzle platformer that's more of a point-and-click, but neither of those facets of the game aren't super successful.

The main mechanics of Stick it to the Man! are reading people's minds to gather information and manipulating the world by peeling off stickers and placing them on other things to solve problems, all while avoiding government agents out to get you. 

The mind reading part is tedious. The voice acting is great, but some characters speak very slowly and by the time you finish reading the subtitiles, the character is only halfway through his or her speech. Dialogue cannot be skipped in pieces or scrolled through, only sped up or skipped entirely. 

The puzzles themselves aren't anything special. One of the recurring "puzzles" (if you may call it that) is escaping the agents trying to get you. I didn't enjoy any of these segments. I'm assuming the game expects you to cleverly sneak around the enemies, placing stickers on them to make them fall asleep or distract them. However, this is usually impossible to do as you can't see all the agents on the screen at once and you have only a few seconds before they notice you and start chasing you around. It's much easier to just run to the other side than trying to spend time sticking stickers on people and getting caught.

Stick it to the Man's strongest element is its art style. The character design is amazing as every character looks unique with a different personality. Everything has a cardboard or paper-y texture, but it's different than, say, Paper Mario. It's almost as if the game would be stronger as a cartoon instead of a video game, or maybe if the focus was more on a point-and-click style than a platformer.

Overall, I don't think I can recommend this game as a game, but, if you like art and design, it might be worth it to at least try it.

10842920.review:
When I first started looking at this game, I was expecting a point-and-click adventure game, and I am not a massive fan of those. However I was taken by surprise. This is not a point and click adventure game - it's a platformer and a damn good one at that!

There are some really tricky platforming challenges throughout the 9 chapters. You will be swinging and jumping from platform to platform to out run the bad guys. The actual puzzles in the game are more trial and error, there were moments where I was absolutely stuck and couldn't work out what to do next,  and had to result to just spam clicking each object in hope something happened.

Control wise, very simple. I used the Xbox controller and had absolutely no problems at all. I can imagine it would be a little more difficult with keyboard and mouse, but name me a platformer that isn't like that.

The story is actually quite enthralling as well.  I didn't really think that such a simple looking game would have such a fulfilling story.  I couldn't wait to find out how the game ended. There are plenty of little "side stories" which all come with some sort of value to the puzzles as a whole.

The games definite strong point is the humor in the writing. I was laughing throughout the whole playthrough and if you like a good laugh while playing a video game, you will not be disappointed here.

10632532.review:
This is an interesting concept for a game. Basically a man named Ray get's hit on the head and brain slug possesses his mind, giving him the ability to read other peoples thoughts and rip them out to convenience himself. The game plays like a fast paced point and click game where you wander through the levels reading minds and taking their thoughts and using the objects taken to get others help you get through each chapter. The humor goes from dark to self aware, but always keeps this upbeat additude that makes  anything dark hilarious. Like a chef who wants to flavor his stew, and requires the tears of a broken heart for flavor, and then pulls a severed human arm out to taste test the stew. You also have to contend with a mysterious organization that wants the brain slug back and the become an obstacle in Ray way and slowly becoming the big threat in the game. 

As far as replayablity goes, it's pretty much non-existant save for getting any achivements you haven't gotten. The games charm comes from interacting all the characters and their quirks and once you beat the game, and complete the puzzles  these points become pointless and you can pretty much beat the game in a third of the time in a second playthrough. because of this, the 14.99 price tag seems steep, so i would recommend getting it when it goes on sale. But, either way
it's an enjoyable experience the first go through, and you could always get someone else to playthrough the game and watch.

10188809.review:
頭に宇宙人が寄生してしまった冴えない男が、そのエイリアンを狙う組織の陰謀によって追われる立場となるという、よくあると言えばあまりによくあるアメリカン娯楽映画ストーリー。
随所にユーモア(ブラックな)がちりばめられて、あほらしいながらもついつい最後までプレイしてしまう。

ゲームの進行はごく単純なクリックアドベンチャー的で、特定のアイテムを掴んだ状態で特定のポイントをクリックすること、の連続。
謎解きというほど考える場面もなく、てきとうにポチポチやってたら終わるので、しっかり脳みそを使って遊びたい人には不完全燃焼かな。
マップを左右に移動しながらクリックできるアイテムを探して、アイテムをゲットしたら使うポイントを探して、それらが全部片付くと次のチャプターに行く。だけ。
アイテムをポイントにあわせてクリックする、だけであるにもかかわらず、なぜか街の中は落下すると即死する穴だらけで、ジャンプしまくる必要があるし、中盤以降は敵エージェントにつかまらないようにキレのないアクションをぐだぐだやる必要があったり、これはいったい何ゲーなんだ、という印象は払拭できない。

基本的にはアイテムを置いたときに起こる変化とそれにともなうトークを楽しむゲームなので、ゲーム的な楽しさは期待しないほうがいいと思います。
冒頭に述べたようにストーリーがとてもピクサー映画的なのもあり、ジョークとストーリーを楽しむためのインタラクティブコミックだと思えばいいかもしれない。

謎解きらしい謎解きはないので、というか間違ったアイテムを使おうとしても「使えない」って言われるだけで、自然と総当りでクリアできちゃうので、進行的には英語力はまったく必要ないです。
ただ、ジョークとストーリーを楽しむという点では英語能力がそれなりにあるに越したことはないかと思います。

Отличная игра с приветом. С приветами. Привет, шестидесятые, привет, "Стар Трек", привет, "Психонавты", привет, "Футурама". Еще очень. очень много приветов. И при этом игре вполне себе удается остаться собой. Да, и еще один привет: подзабытая "Stubbs the Zombie". Почему? Потому, что "Stick it to the man" - игра-то тоже, как и "Stubbs", собссно, про любовь. 

В этой двумерной-трехмерной смеси мультика, адвенчуры и стелс-аркады с любовью намешаны: классический герой-лузер, его девушка, дружелюбный космический мозговой слизняк, темный злодей с ооочень темным прошлым, проведенным на унитазе, робомама злодея, побег из психушки вместе с капитаном Ахавом на его надувной китихе, зомби, Санта-Клаус и его красноносый друг, два Элвиса, как минимум один беременный генерал и космофон из консервной банки. 

И еще с десяток парочек, нашедших свою судьбу (ведь это мы их свели, своими собственными... эээ.... рукой).  

Все лепо: графика, озвучка, музыка, юмор, здоровое безумие, если можно так выразиться. Заскучать абсолютно не успеваешь. Если что, в особо раздражающих агентских местах делаем выдох на "паххх", сосредотачиваемся и спокойно пропрыгиваем. 

Тэд, в буквальном смысле затрахавший мозги Рэю, в строках своего письма голубиной космической почты видимо намекает на продолжение... Но не надо, лучше не надо. Такие вещи должны оставаться в единственном экземпляре.

9943598.review:
It can be difficult to put into words exactly how I feel about this, but here goes my best...

I am a serious lover of DoubleFine Production games, they always seem to catch the right kind of amount of humor, adventure, and intrigue that I look for in a game. The craft put into their storytelling is always amazing.

'But Brock,' you say, 'this game is not by DoubleFine at all! Explain yourself!' Well, as I prefaced, this game is a difficult one to pinpoint in my brain, but the one withstanding element throughout the whole thing was this constant reminder of the humor and stylization that DoubleFine creates in their game Psychonauts.

While the story is somewhat lackluster for me in Stick it to the Man, it easily is made up for the sheer volume of interesting character background and stories therein. This game allows the player to enter the mind of most any biological being, dead or alive, and therein the game shines!

There's rich little mini-stories that are perfectly done, and I almost believe that the writers knew about their main story as being straight-forward, so they decided to sprinkle the whole thing with entertaining sub-plots throughout, making an entertaining ride. Anyone who is a fan of DoubleFine-style imagery, give this guy a try!

9921956.review:
[url=http://finalstage.es/stickers-plataformas-y-humor-absurdo-en-nuestro-analisis-de-stick-it-to-the-man/]Final Stage Review [/url]

Cuando se juntan dos estilos de juego diferentes, el resultado puede ser o un auténtico desastre, o una propuesta de lo más acertada. Y si esos géneros son las plataformas y la aventura gráfica, las posibilidades de que fracase aumentan. Pero cuando este mezcla se hace bien, y se adereza con grandes dosis de humor absurdo, el resultado puede ser un título de lo más interesante, como Stick it to the Man.


ANÁLISIS STICK IT TO THE MAN

Jugabilidad

Este es, sin lugar a dudas, el apartado en el que más destaca el juego. Nada más tomar el control del protagonista, nos encontraremos con un juego de plataformas con acción lateral, en el que tendremos que ir superando una serie de obstáculos para llegar hasta nuestro objetivo. Pero al poco de haber empezado a jugar se añadirá un nuevo elemento que hará que la jugabilidad cobre un nuevo significado, acercandose a las aventuras gráficas de Point and Click: nos saldrá un brazo-espagueti rosa de la cabeza.

Esta extremidad adicional, nos permitirá tanto desplazarnos por algunos puntos del escenario como leer las mentes de los personajes del entorno, que puede desembocar en comentarios hilarantes (en especial las menciones a Descartes), o darnos pistas de que hacer para continuar. Además de esto, también lo podremos utilizar para recoger “pegatinas” que tendremos que colocar en el lugar adecuado para superar los diversos de forma bastante original.
Gráficos

La expresión que mejor puede definir el apartado gráfico de este título es “caricatursco“. De principio a fin, no podremos más que poner cara de sorpresa ante los gráficos de este título. Todo, desde personajes a objetos y paisajes, están hechos de papel y cartón. Esto hace que las dos dimensiones salgan de la jugabilidad para introducirse en los propios personajes.


Además, con un sentido del humor único que caracteriza este título, los personajes harán diversos comentarios a este respecto (como por ejemplo los problemas de manejar un avión de cartón bajo una gran tormenta). Por si esto no fuera suficiente para hacernos reír, los “checkpoints“, que nos permitirán reaparecer si morimos, son impresoras que recompondrán al protagonista sobre una hoja de papel.

Sonido

Quizás este sea el apartado más flojo del juego. El doblaje (solo disponible en inglés) cumple su papel sobradamente, pero cuando llevamos varias horas seguidas, empieza a hacerse un poco repetitivo el marcado “acento paleto” que tratan de imprimir en casi todos los personajes.

En cuanto al hilo musical, también cumple bastante bien con su cometido, con una variedad de estilos que se adapta a cada situación, pero la mayoría de ellos gira en torno al blues o el jazz.
Historia

Ya hemos hablado varias veces del sentido del humor tan absurdo con el que cuenta este título, y que hace que el juego tenga uno de los guiones más surrealistas y divertidos que hemos visto en los últimos tiempos.


El protagonista es Ray Doewood, un joven que no tiene muy claro que hacer en la vida. Por ello decide entrar a trabajar como “probador de cascos”. Su vida será más o menos típica (dentro de lo que puede ser típico en este alocado universo) hasta que un accidente de avión hará que un alien se infiltre en su cerebro, dándole poder psíquicos. A partir de ese momento, intentará descubrir de donde vienen esos poderes, a la par que trata de escapar de unos hombres misteriosos que quieren capturarle.
Conclusión

En definitiva, Stick it to the Man es un juego divertido, ideal para pasar un rato rascándote el cerebro (imagina hacerlo con un brazo-espagueti rosa) mientras te ríes a carcajada limpia con un humor realmente absurdo. El gran inconveniente es su escasa duración, que no permite llegar a disfrutar al 100% de toda la originalidad que derrocha el título.

9886192.review:
Stick It To The Man has quickly cemented itself as my absolutely favorite video game of all time ever since I played it a year ago on the Vita. The writing, art design, voices, and the story itself have this charm that I for one consider a breath of fresh air in what is quickly becoming a stale industry full of grays and browns and scruffy guys with even scruffier voices (and guns, lots and lots of guns).

This game does have some faults like every game has; it's much shorter than you'd expect and there's a small glitch near the end that pretty much makes it impossible to die

Wait...are those the only faults I could find? Oh shoot that's not bad

Despite its short game time, Stick It is a very satisfying and hilarious experience that'll make you fall in love with the characters and come back for more (Stick It sequel perhaps? Hmmmmm?). I totally recommend buying this if you're a fan of quirky, well written, and overall well made video games

9321407.review:
PROS: Very enjoyable, Great game to come back to
CONS: Short term replayability is limited, Some levels may be disappointing

I remember playing a game on the Super NES called Plok, when I was younger.  That was one of the games I grew up on.  I also recall Earthworm Jim on the Sega Genesis as well (one of the games available on Sega Channel).  I bought this game because it looked to be about as silly as both of those games.  And it was.  Contrary to what the negative reviews say, I found myself laughing out loud at some of the jokes.  As for the title song, it fell flat for me when I listened to it on it's own; however, as a theme/title screen song for the game it fits in well.  The music for the rest of the game (during the levels) was far better though.  Overall the experience was enjoyable.  

The puzzle solving in this game is unique.  It definitely wasn't what I was expecting, but it was by no means unwelcome.  However, there are a few levels that, taken as a whole, could have been reworked.  These are the levels where there are little to no puzzles.  It wasn't disappointing to me because they fit well with the storyline.  I also make it a point to go into a new game with minimal expectations, but if I was expecting lots of puzzles those levels might disappoint me overall.  The main drawback for me is short term replayability.  I'm expecting to finish out the Steam Achievements in maybe another playthrough or two.  I got nearly half of them already and I'm on the final chapter during my first playthrough.

Once I'm done with the Steam Achievements, I probably won't play this game again in the near future.  However, I will definitely come back to it from time to time.

9290596.review: "Stick it to the Man" is hands down one of the most hilarious and original games I have played this year. Poor Ray, a bit of a shlub, being in the wrong place at the wrong time, ends up with a telekinetic/telepathic alien stuck inside his head. On the run from a shady government organization he has to use his new found powers to read the minds of everyone around him, steal the thoughts from their minds and then use them to solve the obstacles between him and safety. The writing is some of the best I've seen in a long time, even just eavesdropping on people who have no relevance to your current obstacle is well worth the laughter it brings. There is a trailer. 9273624.review:
Ce jeu mérite vraiment un 20/20, il est gé-nial !

Stick it to The Man! est un hybride de Point & Click et de jeu de plateforme. Je suis un grand fan de Point & Click, et je n'ai pas peur de le mettre dans mon Top 3, limite en première ou seconde position!

En gros vous incarnez Ray, un testeur de casque de chantier qui, a la suite d'un coup sur la tête, se retrouve avec une étrange main psychique qui sort de son crane, et qui lui permet d'interagir avec son environnement, et surtout de lire dans les pensées des gens! Une étrange organisation essaye d'attraper Ray pour récupérer son pouvoir...

Graphiquement, le jeu est absolument magnifique, ca m'a fait énormément penser au dessin animé Corneille&Bernie, en un peu plus sombre, et très jazzy, bien 90's. De plus, l'univers du jeu est tout plat, un peu comme dans Paper Mario, et les habitants en ont parfois conscience d'ailleurs! Du point de vue du gameplay c'est assez génial, les mouvements sont fluides, et le pouvoir de Ray permet de décoller des morceaux entier de décor pour révéler des éléments cachés! Le jeu est découpé en chapitres, l'humour est absolument génial et omniprésent, et on ne se lasse pas de lire dans l'esprit des gens tellement c'est drôle!

le jeu est en VO et les voix sont vraiment trop marrantes, le jeu a une option pour mettre les sous titres français, et même s'il y a quelques petites erreurs, le travail est bien fait, et pourtant ce n'est pas simple de retranscrire la totalité des blagues de la VO!

Les énigmes sont d'une bonne difficulté parfois, mais il n'y a rien d'insurmontable, on est jamais bloqué pour ainsi dire.

Un des très très très gros point fort du jeu, c'est sa bande originale bien jazzy, qui est absolument excellente!

J'ai passé 6 heures a rigoler, vraiment! C'est exactement le type d'univers que j'adore, tous les personnages sont géniaux, il y a un vrai rythme, ce qui pourtant est souvent le grand défaut des Point & Click.

Au niveau des succès, ils faut explorer tout le jeu, mais c'est un réflexe pour les vrais fans de Point & Click me direz vous!

Je le recommande vivement! Du très grand jeu vidéo!

8976383.review:
There have been a number of attempts to get the point and click genre to connect with both modern day gamers and to fit onto consoles in a more natural way. Stick it to the Man is the latest game to try and add a bit more adventure to our lives and does so with some platform elements, a bunch of stickers and a strange alien spaghetti hand.

The somewhat crazy story follows the character of safety helmet tester Ray. One day on his way home a strange canister drops out of the sky and hits him on the head. The canister contains a strange little alien named Ted (Who looks a bit like a cute Krang from the Turtles cartoon). Ted hides inside Ray’s brain and grants him the power to read people’s minds via a giant alien spaghetti arm he now has growing out of his head.

It sounds odd and it is, invoking more than a few memories of Psychonaughts in terms of style and tone. Ray must use his new powers to escape the people who are hunting him and find out what has happened to his girlfriend. This is done via a combination of light platforming sections and using the hand to read people’s minds, find out what they want and then slapping the appropriate sticker into their thought bubble.

The graphical style of the game represents the world in a pop-up book style. Characters are paper thin and everything comes across like a twisted comic book. It’s a style that works really well and it helps to add charm and humour to the already excellent script and characters. Stripping the outside of buildings off like paper to reveal what’s going on inside in a particularly nice touch.

The game is 2D and has Ray move around a set map. Around the map are agents looking to capture him and this is where the platforming comes in. You can use Ray’s alien hand to grab hold of drawing pins and pull him to different places. Using this ability and a combination of stickers that make agents fall asleep or become confused, you have to make your way undetected past the goons to the next area. Being caught results in restarting from a nearby checkpoint so though the controls can be a little bit loose it never caused us any frustration.

The puzzles for the most part are fairly logical (at least within the logic of the world), and we never came across anything that had us stumped or frustrated for a massive amount of time. The only slightly odd puzzles that are likely to stop you dead are when you need to get people to follow you. One in the mental asylum springs to mind where a character repeatedly said that an object would be perfect for her cat but actually needed to be led somewhere else.

Puzzles generally involve reading a characters mind which creates a thought bubble. From here it’s all about grabbing stickers from people’s thoughts and taking them to the appropriate place to use them. This is what you’ll be doing for the bulk of your time and it’s a testament to the design that it doesn’t feel like one giant fetch quest (which effectively all point and click adventures are). 

Stick it to the Man isn’t massively long but it offers up an inventive and fun adventure that you can’t help but like. It came as a nice surprise as we hadn’t really heard much about the game before. What we have here is a combination of a good script and some fun play mechanics which create a fairly unique title. If you’re looking for something a little different or want to test out your puzzle solving skills then this could be the game for you.

Overall 8/10

8923445.review:
En el afán de innovar, los juegos independientes se llevan todos los aplausos pero también la atención, porque una de las primeras cosas que me interesaron al encontrarme con Stick It To The Man fue su sinopsis.  Y es que Zoink! quiso dar su salto a la PC y consolas (se dedicaban exclusivamente a juegos para iOS y Android) tirando todo por la ventana con este juego, cuya premisa plantea un joven con un fideo rosa que le sale de la cabeza. 
En Stick It To The Man -un medio camino entre ser un juego point and click y un plataformero - la estrella es su historia tan descabellada como graciosa: Ray Doewood se gana la vida como un aburrido tester de sombreros cuando una noche de tormenta volviendo a su casa, un paquete misterioso cae de un avión militar y lo golpea en la cabeza. Al despertar se encuentra con un fideo rosa saliéndole del cerebro, que no solo le permite colgarse de ganchos sino que ahora también puede leer la mente de todos los que lo rodean. Nada contento con lo sucedido The Man, líder de la operación, envía a sus súbditos para atrapar a Ray y extirparle su nuevo parásito.

Tanto gráficamente como por su historia y humor el juego se siente como si hubiese salido de las manos del mismísimo Tim Schaffer. De hecho tuve que chequear nuevamente quienes eran los creadores del juego una vez que empecé a jugarlo.

El arte es muy interesante; si bien se trata de escenarios que representan edificios y objetos de cartón y papel, logra ser muy oscuro y turbio en más de una ocasión. Cada capítulo nos ofrece un mapa bastante extenso y diferente al anterior. Contando con más de 100 personajes, cada uno  con un pensamiento y arte único a excepción de los guardias, que son exactamente iguales.

Si bien se define como un juego de plataformas,  en más de una ocasión se sienten como una mera excusa para que el juego dure un poco más. Los movimientos del personaje son muy simples y sólo plantean un cierto desafío al momento de escapar de los guardias. En estas instancias el juego incentiva a leerle la mente a los guardias y obtener así, stickers que nos permitan dormirlos o hacer que persigan a otros guardias. Pese a que el juego aumenta su dificultad no basta para que estos encuentros sean desafiantes y se convierten en bastante aburridos, por lo que es más recomendado simplemente valerse de nuestros movimientos y los ganchos estratégicamente colocados para escapar. 

Toda la idea de plataformas se considera un agregado más para Stick It To The Man pero también podría haber funcionado si sólo se tratase de un point and click. Entre los personajes podemos encontrar un general embarazado, una yeti con el corazón roto o una enfermera enamorada de un zombie, todos con sus diálogos y pensamientos únicos que sorprenden por el humor bizarro e ilógico. Los puzzles consisten en conseguir stickers  gracias a los pensamientos de quien nos crucemos y en general el juego se resuelve en forma de dominó: una vez que consigamos el primer sticker, podremos conseguir el siguiente, y el siguiente, y así hasta terminar el capítulo. No siempre es claro cuál es el final del capítulo por lo que es probable que lo terminemos sin haber usado todos nuestros stickers. De todas maneras, el juego permite rejugar todos los capítulos pero desde cero, lo cual es bastante tedioso si tenemos que volver a escuchar todos los diálogos y pensamientos (a pesar de que se puedan adelantar).

Otra de las grandes joyitas de Stick It To The Man radica en su gran banda de sonido. Es casi imposible empezar a jugarlo sin quedarse escuchando la canción del menú. Además, el juego permite avanzar y retroceder la velocidad en la mayoría de diálogos del juego y la canción no es la excepción. Desgraciadamente esto también constituye uno de los bugs del juego ya que si se juega con el gamepad, el mínimo movimiento del stick cambia la velocidad del diálogo.

Si buscamos plataformas desafiantes puede que Stick It To The Man no sea la mejor opción pero gracias a diálogos brillantes, variedad en los personajes y un arte innovador  logra sorprender y asegurar diversión por unas buenas 6 horas.

8798376.review: Witty, charismatic, point-and-click adventure / puzzle AND -platformer- game that is story-based with an amazing soundtrack which fit the scenes and atmosphere perfectly. Unique, funny storyline with a lot of dark humour, and creative graphics! The entire world is made out of cardboard / paper.  I enjoyed the strangeness of it all and found myself giggling many times. ;P  I'd love to explain the premise, but I wouldn't know how to do so since it is so (pleasantly) bizzare!  In summary.. you have many abilities; one of which is to read people's minds. Your main goal, thanks to being able to read their minds, is to help those in need with an 'extra' arm/hand that grew out of your head (weird, I know~!).  In order to help them resolve their issues, you have to swing around on different platforms with that extra arm; pick objects up, and subsequently stick those new objects onto other places or onto people to solve puzzles. Weird? ..Absolutely! Fun? ..Definitely!  Underrated? ..me thinks so. I highly recommended it if you're into a game that is deeply story-based, with humour and creative visuals.  ..Orrrrr if you're suffering from nostalgia from those classic point-and-click adventure games like I am. Keep in mind, however, that it is ALSO a platformer! :)  All in all, me likey!

This is a very rare game, indeed, but not a boring rare game (as VOID or alike), just a full of originality and humor game that it's playable and delivers tons of fun.

Put in a coctel shaker a tad of Grim Fandango, a tad of Jim Earth Worm, a tad of Toejam and Earl, a tad of South Park, a tad of LSD, shake it all with attitude and you get this game.

At a first glance, graphics can seem kiddy and un-exciting but, has South Park bad graphics and story or, they are just different and you end loving them?. Same here. All scenarios and characters are carefully designed and, the overall ambientation is really well made.

Easy at the beginning, goes harder step by step.
There are some crazy puzzles, well, sort of!. You usually have to get something to continue the story but, to get that you need to solve a chain of little puzzles in a row first, with no other clues than what your brain-readings say to you  but, not that hard. I was stuck just a couple of times.

A drop of platform, a drop of adventure, a drop of puzzle-solving, a drop  of humor, a drop of everything fills a cup of fun and originality.
While there are some rare games that come with some original idea, some doesn't work and are really boring as VOID or alike and, some are really exciting, as PAPO AND ME or just this one.
Giving the bunch of originality and humor, you can find it short.

8663272.review:
Stick It To The Man! è un platform-adventure con elementi tipici dei puzzle game e con un game design che oserei quasi definire innovativo e soprattutto estremamente divertente ed appassionante. In Stick It To The Man! vestiremo i panni di Ray un ragazzotto un po’ atipico che a seguito di un bizzarro incidente vedrà spuntare dalla sua testa uno strambo braccio rosa, a cui appioppa il nome di “spaghetti-arm”, che gli conferirà poteri telepatici e soprattutto la capacità di acchiappare oggetti e appiccicarli ovunque ce ne sia bisogno. Credendo di essere impazzito, il nostro protagonista, si affida ad improbabili dottori in cerca di una cura a quello che, invece, sarà la sua unica arma per sconfiggere The Man, un misterioso figuro che tenterà di rovinargli la vita. [...] 
Ma la vera opera d’arte, i simpaticoni di Zoink! l’hanno realizzata con il doppiaggio e soprattutto i dialoghi di Stick It To The Man!. I personaggi, protagonisti e non, caratterizzati fin nei minimi dettagli con un doppiaggio da prodotti di primissima categoria che si sposano perfettamente con le caricature che popolando il mondo di gioco. Voci che variando di tono, intensità e accento rendono perfettamente l’idea su che tipo di personaggio ci troviamo davanti, dall’idiota tutto muscoli al vecchio verme depravato, il tutto condito da dialoghi comici ed esilaranti che, questa volta sul serio, vi strapperanno spesso qualche risata

Leggi l'intera recensione su: http://theshelternetwork.com/stick-it-to-the-man/

8154995.review:
Stick it to The Man is a fun, puzzle sloving game with some very simple jumping aspects.  You are equipped with a pink hand that extends from the top of your head.  This hand is used to read the minds of those around you and grab onto surrounding pegs for increased mobility.  Most of the game consists of completing tasks that progress you to the next chapter.  The game is on the short side; I completed it in about three hours.  There is little replayability, unless you want to go through and get all of the Steam achievements.  

The puzzles are pretty simple and most could even be solved with trial and error, so if you're looking for a challenging game, this isn't it.  The real appeal for me was the dialogue.  The characters and dialogue are hilarious.  I thought the voice acting was really well done.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this game.

8144700.review: Stick it to The Man! is a very creative adventure/casual game, your purpose being to collect and place stickers to advance forward through the levels. Although this game is fun and at times challenging its not something i can seee myself putting hours into, it's just not quite diverse enough. It would be nice if it wasnt so linear, maybe more toward scribblenaut's sanbox style, being able to place stickers not just where you are supposed to but other places to open alternate routes or just to have fun would be a nice touch. All in all a good game, i'll be keeping an eye open for future offering from this developer.

8117546.review:
Damn, Stick It To The Man is just wonderful. The graphics reminded me of Psychonauts, another great game. That's also where the comparison (mostly) stops. Because this game is charming, fun and original, and it manages to do all that all on its own, without the need to copy from other popular games. 

You play as Ray and early on in the story you manage to get an arm sticking out of your head. Not just an arm, it's actually an alien that makes use of your body. With this arm you can read the minds of other people to get hints on what to do next, but some of the people will also be reminded or think of certain events and that way items can be created.

The game plays like a platformer, but the gameplay itself is similar to that of a point-and-click adventure. Minus the frustrating, boring puzzles those games usually have.

The voices are done very well, with plenty of variety as far as characters go.

It's just a shame that this game is so short. A playthrough will last around 4 hours, which is enough, but it's not enough for a wonderful game like this. I enjoyed it all the way through and never got frustrated. That's partly the reason why I hoped it would last longer. Maybe for a possible sequel (the game does hint at one after all). 

A game like this should be a critical and financial success. It truly deserves to be. But I seriously doubt that will happen...

Anyway, let's wrap this up. My verdict: Stick It To The Man is a must-play and must-own for any serious gamer !

[Rating: 88/100]

8078149.review:
A short, psychedelic platformer from indie Swedish developer Zoink that actively encourages the exploration and use of thoughts, psychical characteristics or any other object that your mental spaghetti hand can rip off and apply  as stickerized solutions to aptly Stick it to the Man! It's greatest strength and flaw is its commitment into offering a nonstop experience, that from start to finish, is one long 8 mile trip into a paperized sky. The characters never outlast their welcome or initial joke and controls for this game are exceptionally ported to PC mouse and keyboard. 

While USD 14.99 may be a bit too much for a game that even I could beat in less than 6 hours, at its current discount it’s an absolute steal.

8066118.review:
I gave this game a fighting chance, but in my opinion it's really difficult to enjoy.

It's an adventure/platformer with a huge Little Big Planet feel. You play as a dude who has an alien in his brain, which gives him mind reading powers and, since the alien is basically a stretchy arm, the ability to jump between platforms and grab things like stickers. 

There is a lot of dialog, which might not be unusual for an adventure game, but I feel like I'm never really playing the game. I was unexpectedly shuffled out of a level without being able to finish all of the tasks, because there was no indication to which tasks were the important ones. The game is full of strangers in the city that you have to help, as you run from some bad guys trying to catch you because of the alien attached to your brain. 

To find out what each stranger needs, you have to read their minds with the sticky arm, which is a really cool, unique feature. But like I said, it slows down the game play so much and a lot of the tasks feel really pointless. The graphics are awesome as well, and I love the paper world feel. But the platforms are easy to jump between, or just frustrating when you've got identical bad guys chasing you so that rather than enjoy the new area you just discovered, you have to instead rush through it to get away. 

I really want to love this game, but it's almost impossible. Also, the adventure puzzles are really easy to solve. Once you read everyone's minds, it's really easy to see that you just visit a bunch of places in order and grab the stickers from them and put them elsewhere. 

And this one is really just my opinion, but the characters are so overly dramatic and cliche that I find it grating. I realize they're probably like this on purpose, but for a game with more adult themes it's weird how cartoonish and childish the cast is. 

If you really want to experience this game, maybe wait for it to go on sale. Who knows? You might really like it. It's not a horrible game, but definitely not one I would recommend to buy at full price.

8046390.review: A terrific atmosphere brought about through a unique art style with clever, dark, sarcastic humor throughout. The style of humor is VERY much like that in Psychonauts, transformed into a 2D puzzle platformer. Use your characters newfound powers to read people's minds and get at their deepest, darkest secrets - even if that means crashing your notions of beauty, gender, religion, and the scientific method! So far, the puzzles aren't particularly challenging, but the amazing voice acting and memorable characters make this short indie game a must play. If the game had more replayability through additional secrets/collectibles or some more challenging puzzles, it would be PERFECT. As it is - still 9/10

8046081.review:
It's not THE Psychonauts sequel we've all been waiting for, but it's got nice art style (2D in 3D graphics) and good writing that both look and feel like they were lifted from DoubleFine's concept room. Gameplay is a platformer-stealth-puzzle mix that is quite relaxed most of the time, platforming is a bit sloppy, puzzles are not always logical (but are solvable anyway because of a limited number of possible interactions), stealth is jaringly uneven, but i like setting, art, story and voice acting. 

If you loved Psychonauts (and who didn't?), you are likely to like 'Stick it to The Man!' Now, if only developers bothered with a demo...

8039399.review:
This game is an absolute delight! It's pretty much a must buy, especially at this price. It's about a 4-5 hour game that will continuously make you smile. Where some of the frustration coming from the gameplay is mediated immediately by the hilarious characters and overall lighthearted feel of the game. It's like playing a comedy act, in a sense. It has an amazing artstyle, unique and very pretty. "So much art... such beauty" to paraphrase a certain seagull. The printscreens really doesn't do the game justice.

The gameplay consists of a mixture between platforming, point and click and stealth. It's fine, nothing incredible, but it does it's job. It isn't too hard to progress. It does suffer from having the game be in the way of everything else, where you just want to get past these annoying stealth sessions to get to the good/fun part. The writing and voice acting shined a lot brighter than the gameplay did. This made the mood go down a bit when if you're a complete fuck-up you will be stuck at a few points for a while, but as said before, the game will make it up to you with it's intelligent writing, more or less hilarious humor, artstyle, new and intriguing situations. 

Buy this game, now, please. Go do it. It's the most I've laughed in a game since Psychonauts and it's really something everyone should play. It's a game with personality, a personality you will like, and that's sort of rare. Have fun.
